episodeTitle: The Man Called a Genius! Hogback Appears!
episodeTitleJapanese: 天才と呼ばれた男！ホグバック現る！
episodeTitleRomanized: Tensai to Yobareta Otoko! Hogubakku Arawaru!
description: Nami, Usopp, and Chopper journey through the eerie forest of Thriller Bark, encountering bizarre zombies before reaching the mysterious mansion of the world-famous Dr. Hogback and his peculiar assistant Cindry.

events.title: Journey Through Thriller Bark Forest Begins
events.description: Nami, Usopp, and Chopper ride in Hildon's carriage through the foggy, eerie forest of Thriller Bark. They begin to notice strange and disturbing creatures lurking in the shadows.
events.significance: The trio's journey deeper into Thriller Bark territory sets up their encounter with Dr. Hogback and introduces the unsettling zombie-filled atmosphere of the island.

quotes.text: These are just illusions caused by the fog. Nothing to worry about.
quotes.speaker: Hildon
quotes.context: Hildon dismisses the trio's concerns about the bizarre creatures they're seeing

events.title: Zombie Animals Spotted in the Forest
events.description: The Straw Hats spot various bizarre zombie creatures including a talking tree (MocDonald), a zombie unicorn (Unigaro), and other grotesque undead beings wandering through Thriller Bark's forest.
events.significance: First indication of the widespread zombie presence on Thriller Bark and Gecko Moria's zombie army capabilities.

events.title: Discovery of the Graveyard
events.description: Usopp realizes that Hildon has disappeared and that the carriage has stopped in the middle of a massive graveyard filled with headstones and graves as far as the eye can see.
events.significance: Sets up the zombie platoon attack and forces the trio toward Hogback's mansion.

events.title: Zombie Platoon Attacks
events.description: Zombies suddenly rise from the graves surrounding Nami, Usopp, and Chopper. The undead creatures speak and demonstrate unexpected intelligence and strength, forming a coordinated attack to drive the trio toward the mansion.
events.significance: Demonstrates that these zombies are different from typical undead - they can speak, think, and coordinate. Shows the scale of Moria's zombie army.

events.title: Usopp Fights Zombies with Fire
events.description: Usopp uses his Exploding Stars and fire-based attacks to repel the zombie horde, discovering that the zombies are afraid of fire and are temporarily driven back by flames.
events.significance: Reveals a weakness of the zombies and demonstrates Usopp's resourcefulness in the face of overwhelming odds.

events.title: Arrival at Hogback's Mansion
events.description: Fleeing from the zombie horde, Nami, Usopp, and Chopper finally reach the gates of Dr. Hogback's imposing mansion, seeking refuge from the pursuing undead.
events.significance: Brings the trio to the main location for the next several episodes and sets up their meeting with Hogback and Cindry.

events.title: Victoria Cindry's Debut
events.description: A tall blonde woman named Victoria Cindry emerges from a well at the mansion entrance and bizarrely begins throwing plates at Usopp while greeting the visitors. Her stitched zombie body and pale blue skin reveal her undead nature.
events.significance: Introduces one of the key characters of the Thriller Bark arc and establishes the disturbing presence of zombies even in Hogback's mansion. Her plate-throwing habit hints at her zombie personality.

quotes.speaker: Cindry
quotes.context: Cindry's greeting while throwing plates at Usopp

events.title: Dr. Hogback's Debut
events.description: The world-famous 'Genius Surgeon' Dr. Hogback makes his dramatic appearance, introducing himself to the shocked Straw Hats. Chopper is starstruck, having idolized Hogback as a legendary doctor who mysteriously disappeared from the medical world years ago.
events.significance: Introduces one of the Mysterious Four of Thriller Bark and a major antagonist of the arc. Chopper's admiration for Hogback sets up his later disillusionment when he discovers Hogback's true nature.

quotes.text: I am Dr. Hogback. Welcome to my mansion.
quotes.speaker: Dr. Hogback
quotes.context: Hogback's introduction to the Straw Hats

events.title: Hogback Explains Cindry's Backstory
events.description: Hogback tells the Straw Hats a fabricated story about Cindry, claiming she was once engaged but explaining away her strange behavior and appearance with convenient lies.
events.significance: Establishes the cover story that Hogback uses to hide Cindry's true nature as a zombie reanimated from a famous deceased actress.

events.title: Hogback Discusses Zombie Research
events.description: Dr. Hogback reveals that he is conducting research on zombies and explains his philosophy that zombies are 'gifts' that allow people to reunite with their deceased loved ones. He presents this twisted ideology as noble scientific work.
events.significance: Reveals Hogback's role in creating Thriller Bark's zombie army and his disturbing worldview. This establishes the moral corruption beneath his genius surgeon reputation.

quotes.text: Zombies are gifts that allow people to reunite with their deceased loved ones.
quotes.speaker: Dr. Hogback
quotes.context: Hogback explaining his zombie research philosophy

events.title: Hogback's Suspicious Reaction to Brook
events.description: When the Straw Hats mention Brook, Dr. Hogback displays a strange and suspicious reaction, acting unusually nervous and evasive. His behavior suggests he knows something about the skeleton musician.
events.significance: Foreshadows the connection between Hogback, Gecko Moria, and Brook's shadow. Hints at the larger conspiracy on Thriller Bark.

events.title: Thousand Sunny Caught in Giant Spiderweb
events.description: Meanwhile, the Thousand Sunny drifts toward Thriller Bark and becomes entangled in a massive spiderweb. Despite the ship taking no damage, it becomes stuck and unable to move, trapping Luffy, Zoro, Sanji, Robin, and Franky.
events.significance: Splits the crew and prevents easy escape from Thriller Bark, forcing both groups to confront the island's dangers separately.

events.title: Buhichuck Spotted in the Mansion
events.description: A pig's head mounted on the wall named Buhichuck is seen in Hogback's dining hall. Unknown to the visitors, this is actually a zombie and one of the 'Surprise Zombies' that will later attack.
events.significance: Introduces one of the mansion's hidden zombie guardians, setting up future danger for the Straw Hats.

themes.description: The episode fully embraces horror elements with its graveyard setting, zombie attacks, and gothic mansion atmosphere. The visual design and pacing create genuine tension and fear.
themes.symbolism: The fog-shrouded forest and graveyard represent the obscured truth of Thriller Bark, while the mansion represents false safety.

themes.description: Dr. Hogback represents the corruption of medical science when divorced from ethical constraints. His zombie research perverts the noble goal of saving lives into disturbing necromancy.
themes.symbolism: Hogback's mansion is both a place of healing (as a doctor's residence) and horror (as a zombie laboratory), representing the duality of science used for good or evil.

themes.description: Chopper's excitement at meeting his medical hero Hogback sets up the painful arc of discovering that his idol is a morally bankrupt villain.
themes.symbolism: Hogback's deceptive hospitality mirrors how first impressions can be misleading.

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper is starstruck meeting his medical hero Dr. Hogback, showing his admiration for medical science and legendary doctors. This sets up his later disillusionment.
keyActions: Expresses amazement at meeting the legendary Dr. Hogback
Tries to protect Nami and Usopp from zombies

characterSpotlights.development: Despite his fear, Usopp fights to protect his companions using his ingenuity and fire-based attacks against the zombie horde.

Fights off zombie platoon with fire attacks

characterSpotlights.development: Nami remains suspicious of Hogback and their surroundings despite the doctor's hospitality, showing her practical and cautious nature.
keyActions: Stays alert to danger throughout the journey

characterSpotlights.development: Hogback is introduced as a legendary doctor living in mysterious isolation. His hospitable façade barely conceals his suspicious behavior and twisted morality.

Reacts suspiciously to mention of Brook

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded the zombie attack sequence in the graveyard with additional action scenes and zombie character designs not detailed in the manga.
The scene of the Thousand Sunny caught in the spiderweb was extended in the anime for pacing.

trivia.fact: Episode 340 marks the debut of Dr. Hogback, one of the Mysterious Four of Thriller Bark and a member of the Thriller Bark Pirates.
Victoria Cindry is voiced by two different actresses in Japanese - Naomi Shindō voiced her alive in flashbacks, while Houko Kuwashima voices her zombie form.
This episode adapts Manga Chapter 445 (partial) and Chapter 446 (pages 2-11), with the title 'Doctor Hogback' for Chapter 446.

Episode 340 uses 'Jungle P' as its opening theme, which was the first One Piece opening to feature the Thousand Sunny and Franky as part of the crew, and also featured Brook before he officially joined.
This episode aired during a period (episodes 279-1070) when One Piece had no ending themes, a decision made by Toei Animation to allow for longer opening sequences.
A Pandaman zombie appears among the zombie horde in the graveyard scene, continuing the tradition of Pandaman cameos throughout the series.
Dr. Hogback is 223 cm (7'4") tall with a distinctive round torso, thin limbs, and a semi-circular scar above his eyes.
